title: Latest updates: East Midlands Live Wednesday 1 November 2017 - BBC News
summary: murder investigation launched after teen 's death .
teenager in hospital after lenton stabbing .
factory worker 'ordered poison from is commander ' .
dozens clamped in nottingham vehicle tax clampdown .
bleeding bride ties the knot at halloween wedding .

documents.title: terror suspect 'pledged allegiance to is '
text: terror suspect 'pledged allegiance to is '

documents.title: birthplace of action man set for honour
text: birthplace of action man set for honour

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: today 's live coverage has now come to an end .
it will restart at 08:00 on thursday .

documents.title: weather : cloudy night with chance of light rain
text: after a fine day , cloud will increase overnight and although it will be largely dry a few spots of rain are possible with some fog patches forming by dawn .
author: Anna Church
Weather Presenter, BBC East Midlands Today

documents.title: should the jester from leicester have a mural ?
text: should world snooker champion mark selby have a mural in leicester ?

documents.title: watch : bonfire night safety
text: the fire service in nottinghamshire has put together this video in the lead up to bonfire night .
it 's got lots of handy advice about keeping safe .
warning : may contain third party advertising .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: erratic driver was wanted over sex attack
text: police stopped an erratic driver in mansfield last night and discovered he was someone they 'd been looking for in connection with an alleged sex attack .
as well as testing positive for cannabis and cocaine , the 28-year-old man was also found to be carrying a suspected class a drug in his car .
he was arrested on sus of seven offences - careless driving , driving without insurance , drug possession , two counts of driving under the influence of drugs , sexual assault and threats to kill .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: amber rudd funding warning angers derbyshire police boss
text: derbyshire 's police and crime commissioner says he 's astonished the home secretary has told police forces to stop asking for more money .
amber rudd told a conference of chief constables they needed to find new ways of cutting crime without increased funding .
labour pcc hardyal dhindsa said : `` police chiefs are not asking for more money just for the sake of it .
`` we 've had some tough decisions and we 've done efficiencies , savings , but eight years of continued under-funding means it can not carry on . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing woman from kirklees : can you help ?
text: a 61-year-old woman from kirklees has gone missing after a trip to london yesterday .
penelope jackson , from honley , went to st pancras station in london on tuesday and was reported missing this morning
she 'd been staying in the huddersfield area and has links with the leicester area .
we are concerned for penelope 's well-being as she may be in need of medication . ''

documents.title: rugby : injured may to miss argentina match
text: leicester 's jonny may is set to miss england 's opening autumn international against argentina after sustaining a hamstring injury during the squad 's training camp in portugal .
this limits eddie jones ' wing options further with elliot daly and jack nowell already being ruled out of the majority of the twickenham programme .
it leaves england with only three fit players in the position for the visit of the pumas - anthony watson , denny solomona and semesa rokoduguni .
losing may would be a significant blow as the 27-year-old has been in blistering form since swapping gloucester for leicester this season , crossing 10 times in nine matches for the tigers .
author: Press Association

documents.title: large group 'threw fireworks into shop '
text: a group of men threw fireworks into a shop before smashing it up with sticks and a baseball bat .
police said up to seven men were involved in the disorder at the top market store in sneinton dale at about 19:45 yesterday .
there were also reports fireworks were thrown in the street outside the shop .
the trouble followed a large fight in the same area which saw police arrest two men aged 24 and 29 .
nottinghamshire police said further arrests were anticipated .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: m6 crash death driver 'messaged footballer '
text: a driver was messaging a nottingham forest striker shortly before he struck and killed a highway worker on the m6 , a jury has heard .
peter morrison , 37 , denies causing death by dangerous driving but has pleaded guilty to careless driving .
adam gibb died and paul holroyd was seriously injured in the crash near tebay , cumbria , in february 2016 .
carlisle crown court heard details of messages sent and received by the 37-year-old from worsley , salford .
the final whatsapp message mr morrison sent was to nottingham forest striker zach clough .
author: Catherine Lee
BBC News online

documents.title: nude charity tennis calendar trouble
text: nude charity tennis calendar trouble

documents.title: man 'threatened with gun ' during test drive
text: a man jumped from his moving range rover to save himself after being threatened with a gun while taking three men for a test drive .
the 45-year-old was with the trio as they drove the car along cuttholme road in chesterfield when one of them pulled out what he thought was a firearm and threatened him .
he escaped the car as it approached ashgate road but his vehicle was stolen by the men .
it happened at about 20:10 on 25 october .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: emergency call made for kebab
text: maybe try calling a takeaway restaurant next time .
@ twitterid thanks to the mindless # idiot calling 999 yesterday requesting a kebab .
do it again & i 'll personally give you a fixed penalty
you are joking right ?
called 999 and asked for a kebab ?
if it was n't so stupid i 'd find out funny .
should be fined regardless .
it 's pity those abusing 999 system and emergency personnel ca n't be removed from any sort of response .
instead of lamb , you should give him a portion of truncheon meat
a salad is more healthy .
really ?
i like me a shish doner mix kebab , but i do n't think it 's ever been that much of an emergency !
yikes
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: schools prepare for epic children in need sing-song
text: children from radcliffe-on-trent junior school have been getting ready for their big children in need performance with a little help from pudsey .
a total of 233 pupils from nine schools in nottinghamshire will be gathering at nottingham 's albert hall on 17 november to sing a jazz version of somewhere over the rainbow .
they 're part of a nationwide choir of more than 1,500 children performing the track live as part of bbc one 's children in need coverage .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cordon remains at scene of lenton stabbing
text: a cordon is still in place at albert grove in lenton where a 19-year-old man was found stabbed this morning .
police have mounted extra patrols to reassure residents .
two sections of the cordon separate the road itself and the scene of the attack .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your photos : autumn in leicestershire
text: here 's how birstall 's looking today .
thanks to craig the greenkeeper for the
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: woman trapped in her car after whetstone crash
text: the fire service says it 's working to free a woman who 's trapped in a car that 's ended up on its side following a crash in whetstone .
the air ambulance is there and the road has been closed .
14:41 | road closure | enderby rd , whetstone currently closed while officers deal with an rtc .
please find an alternative route .
16:47 | road re-opened | enderby rd & victoria rd junction , whetstone has now been re-opened .
thank you for your patience
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: lane closed on m1 after breakdown
text: this is the current scene on the m1 southbound between j29 and j28 where a lane is closed because of a broken-down vehicle .
it looks like traffic 's flowing fairly freely despite the closure .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: police increase patrols after stabbing
text: a police cordon is in place in lenton after a teenager was stabbed in the chest .
it happened on albert grove early this morning .
the 19-year-old man was taken to hospital where he remains in a serious condition .
police have said patrols in the area have been `` stepped up '' to provide reassurance for the local community .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: drivers thanked for 'patience ' during m1 lorry fire
text: in case you missed the drama between junctions 20 and 21 of the m1 yesterday
the northbound carriageway was closed for about two hours .
the southbound side closed for more than four hours , reopened for rush hour , then closed again overnight for resurfacing .
fortunately , the driver was uninjured .
thanks for everyone 's patience yesterday during the m1 closure .
we do n't close motorways unless absolutely necessary .
pics tell the story !
silly twat had fireworks on the lorry apparently .
what , other than a fire , did he expect to happen ?
paige , i do n't know where you 've got that incorrect information from .
it was deodorant and shampoo on the load !
not fireworks .
i heard it was fireworks but unsure where from !
well deodorant is just as bad for causing fires so , again , what more did he expect ?
well it would appear you 'd heard incorrect information , & perhaps best not to make such comments if not aware of full correct facts .
is n't my problem that i 'd heard a different story lol .
have nothing against the driver .
heard he 's okay and that 's all that matters .
driver ok ?
yes , he was fine , he managed to get tractor unit clear of the trailer and was uninsured .
uninsured or uninjured ?
ha ha ! !
well spotted alan !
predictive text at its best !
definitely uninjured !
i missed that by not many moons !
i wonder how many impatient drivers phoned in and complained because their journey was disrupted ?
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: driver caught speeding nearly triple the limit
text: a motorist has been caught by police driving at 87mph in a 30mph zone in fleckney .
the driver was one of 15 caught breaking the speed limit on saddington road during a three-hour operation this morning .
another two drivers were found to have no insurance and had their vehicles seized .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: investigation after fire at shepshed factory
text: up to eight fire crews were involved in tackling a blaze at a factory in shepshed last night .
leicestershire fire and rescue service received several calls about the fire on ashby road central just before 21:00 .
a crew from loughborough was due to revisit the scene this morning to reinspect the site .
the cause of the fire is currently `` under investigation '' .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : skinner on hs2 's 'second-class citizens '
text: today 's prime minister 's questions began with bolsover mp dennis skinner demanding to know why homes in the north of england were being demolished to make way for hs2 but were being protected by tunnels in the south .
theresa may responded it was a question for the department for transport but said hs2 would bring major benefits to the north .
in southern 'leafy suburbs ' , 30 % of # hs2 route will have tunnelling , but that falls to 2 % in the north to save money , claims dennis skinner
pointless project .
use west coast mainline virtually every week.journey time is n't a problem .
crap phone signal , wifi & virgin service is .
it 's not about journey time # hs2 is about capacity ( still probably the wrong economic climate for this project though )
84 % of the claimed benefits of # hs2 are the monetised value of time saved .
see lords report .
it is all about max speed .
time saved = increased capacity qed
i 'm afraid time saved does not equal increased capacity .
i 'm afraid you 're wrong if the journey takes half the time you can run twice a many trains simple maths
too simple maths i 'm afraid .
they may be related but are not equal .
the underground is a very high cspacity railway .
rather slow though .
well said dennis skinner .
country that works for everyone ?
destroying new build houses , ancient woodland ?
does that work for everyone ? # hs2
the whole project is a pointless waste of money
it will be a great deal for a select few .
rarely agree with taxpayer dressed dennisskinner , must now !
the # londonelite can not bear # taxpayer funds being spent outside london & se !
hs 2 is a cameron vanity project .
close an osborne one !
he is so right i 'm sick to death of the tory government treating us here in the north as nothing but scum may is full of like all tory gov
unfortunately labour support this project too .
they 're all happy to fob us off
not as much as tory governments have going way back to thatcher there is a north south divide we in the north are seen as second class
i have no faith in any of them especially when it comes to transport
its not just about transport that is only half the problem why pull down homes here in the north yet down south they manage to build tunnel
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: murder police comb scene of teen 's death
text: police are at the scene of a suspected murder in leicester .
a 17-year-old boy died after being found injured on ross walk last night .
another teenager is receiving treatment for `` injuries not believed to be life threatening '' .
a 16-year-old boy has been arrested on sus of murder and attempted murder .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager arrested over boy 's killing
text: teenager arrested over boy 's killing

documents.title: forest defeat a warning - warburton
text: forest defeat a warning - warburton

documents.title: motorcyclist killed in crash named
text: police have named a motorcyclist who died in a crash in osbaston at the weekend as 47-year-old david rowley .
the motorbike he was riding collided with a car on the a447 hinckley road on sunday afternoon .
mr rowley , from normanton le heath , was pronounced dead at the scene .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenage girl goes missing in mapperley
text: police are worried about a 16-year-old girl who 's been missing for five days .
megan linley was last seen in the mapperley area at about 20:00 on friday .
anyone who knows where she might be is asked to call 101 .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : notts sign new opener
text: nottinghamshire have signed batsman chris nash on a three-year deal .
the 34-year-old right-handed opener moves to trent bridge after being released by sussex last week .
notts head coach peter moores handed nash his first contract at sussex and the former england lions player said he was looking forward to playing for him again .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager in hospital after lenton stabbing
text: a 19-year-old man has been taken to hospital after being stabbed in the chest outside a house in lenton .
police said it happened in albert grove shortly before 06:00 .
the teenager is in a serious condition and a cordon has been put up while investigations are carried out .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : pleasure boat lifted from water
text: boat enthusiasts gathered at cromford wharf this morning to watch a historic boat being lifted out of the canal .
the birdswood was originally built in the 1930s as a coal transporter - but four years ago was purchased and turned into a visitor attraction .
it 's being inspected and cleaned before returning to the water in december ready for christmas boat trips .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: breakingteen 's death prompts murder investigation
text: police have launched a murder investigation following the death of a teenager .
emergency services were called to ross walk in the belgrave area of leicester last night .
two 17-year-old boys were found injured - one has since died .
police are treating the death as sus
the second teenager 's injuries are not believed to be life threatening and he is undergoing treatment .
a 16-year-old boy has been arrested on sus of murder and attempted murder .
he is in police custody being questioned by detectives .
police have closed off roads in the area while they carry out a forensic examination .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket boss talks of work pressure
text: leicestershire county cricket 's chief executive said the last six months have been the `` hardest of his life '' .
the foxes finished bottom of the county championship after failing to win a single game this season .
the club also faced having points deducted and a player leaving .
wasim khan said : `` you ca n't help but take it personally because you feel so passionately about what you 're doing .
a loss is horrible .
`` driving back to birmingham after we 've lost a game and it hurts .
you find it hard to distance yourself emotionally from that because you 're putting you life and soul into it . ''
he 's confident the club 's new head coach paul nixon will help turn things around .
he 's also learnt to stop taking work home with him .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man charged after city centre underpass stabbing
text: a teenager has been charged after another teenager was stabbed during a fight in derby city centre .
police said a 19-year-old man suffered serious injuries when he was attacked in the underpass between bass ' recreation ground and the river gardens on saturday afternoon .
a second 19-year-old man has been charged with wounding with intent and possessing an offensive weapon and is due to appear before magistrates later .
police added the two men are thought to know each other .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: forest beaten at reading
text: defeat at reading last night cost nottingham forest their chance to jump into the play-off places .
two john swift goals and an own goal from reds keeper jordan smith meant all three points went to the home side .
ben osborn scored a late consolation for forest .
forest now sit 13th in the championship table - two points off sixth .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: christmas preparations under way
text: christmas is officially on its way - the 60ft tree is going up in nottingham 's old market square this morning .
it will be decked out with 4,000 lights ready for the switch-on on 17 november .
decorations are also going up across leicester - this is outside the town hall .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: panda encounters horse on a60
text: police had to escort a loose horse from a major road in notts yesterday .
the animal was encountered by officers driving along the a60 near mansfield woodhouse shortly before 17:00 .
pc adam pace said : `` after a short pursuit and with help from the public , the horse was detained and taken back to her field unharmed . ''
small police cars are sometimes referred to as panda cars - just to clear up any confusion over the headline .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: photo appeal after nightclub toilet attack
text: police have released a photo of a woman they believe may have witnessed an assault at a nightclub in derby .
the alleged attack happened in the ladies ' toilet at moomoo clubrooms in st james ' street at about 03:30 on friday 15 september .
det con russell slater said : she is not in any trouble .
however , we are very keen to speak to her as what she witnessed is vital to our investigation . ''
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: mp calls for more 'focus ' on sex assault victims
text: liz kendall has praised a labour party activist who revealed she was the victim of a sex attack at a political event in 2001 .
bex bailey , from nottingham , said she was discouraged from reporting the rape at the time because it could `` damage '' her .
ms bailey used to work for the leicester west mp liz kendall .
she 's told the bbc there are now calls within the party for an independent third-party reporting system to help women speak out if they are a victim .

understandable people within the party , who work for the party , do n't want to see the party brought into disrepute but really they should be focusing on the women who have been subject to harassment or assault . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rowett impressed by growing derby belief
text: rowett impressed by growing derby belief

documents.title: bleeding bride ties the knot at halloween wedding
text: a couple tied the knot in a halloween-themed wedding in derby yesterday .
guests at billy bradshaw and charlene hill 's register office service were asked to don spooky outfits for the occasion .
mr bradshaw , from chaddesden , said : `` she [ charlene ] wanted to have a theme for the wedding .
`` we started with a pajama wedding but then , because halloween was coming up , we thought we 'd do it on halloween and get a halloween theme going on . ''
the bride said : `` it 's all gone to plan and it 's been brilliant . ''
the couple have yet to finalise their honeymoon plans but said they had n't ruled out transylvania .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'lifeline ' bingo hall unexpectedly closes
text: there are fears some older people in coalville could be left lonely and isolated after the local bingo hall closed down .
staff and customers at flutters bingo hall said it shut without any warning .
those who regularly use it gathered to protest outside the building yesterday afternoon .
kerri underwood , who was at the protest , said : `` there is nowhere in coalville , nowhere at all for anybody to go .
some of the old ladies , i 'm friends with a lot of them , some of them are 92 years old and that is their only lifeline . ''
the bbc has spoken to the owner ian tyler who said he 's hoping the bingo hall will be able to continue under new owners once its sold .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rams up to fifth after leeds fightback
text: derby county fought back from a goal down to beat leeds united at elland road last night .
sam winnall scored twice in the second half as the rams won 2-1 to record their fourth consecutive win .
the result lifts derby county to fifth in the championship table .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: posthumous degree to honour murdered student
text: the parents of a murdered student will collect a posthumous degree in her memory .
claire nagle , 38 , died in hospital after being found seriously injured at a house in borrowash , derbyshire last year .
her estranged husband vincent , 44 , died half-an-hour later when he was hit by a lorry on the m1 .
an inquest - which was opened and adjourned - heard her murder was connected with her husband 's death and a violent attack on her son .
claire 's parents will attend a ceremony at the university of nottingham , where she was in her final year studying to be a mental health nurse .
professor joanne lymn , head of health sciences at the university of nottingham , said : claire was a wonderful student who worked hard and achieved impressive results academically and in practice .
`` she would have made an exceptional mental health nurse .
`` the award of a posthumous degree recognises and celebrates claire 's achievements and we hope that the graduation ceremony will provide some comfort for her family . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: all lanes reopen after m1 breakdown
text: hopefully things should start getting back to normal now .
recovery completed for a broken down car on the # m1 s/b btwn j25 + j24a nr # longeaton , all lanes are clear .
earlier delays are clearing .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dozens of vehicles clamped in tax crackdown
text: nearly 60 vehicles have been clamped in nottingham as part of an operation targeting tax evasion .
officials from the dvla are deploying officers across the city trying to identify cars , vans and motorbikes that are n't properly registered
if the owners fail to pay up , the vehicles are impounded .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: long motorway delays caused by break down
text: it 's really not a good morning on the roads - this is the m1 southbound between junctions 26 and 25 .
there are currently delays of 50 minutes caused by an earlier broken down vehicle .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: charity urges action over peak district bird persecution
text: the rspb says it 's concerned about the number of birds of prey being persecuted in derbyshire .
in the past year there have been reports of three poisoned buzzards , a shot peregrine and illegal activity targeted at a hen harrier in the county .
the charity is calling on the police and other authorities to make full use of their existing powers to protect birds of prey .
author: Gavin Bevis
BBC Local Live

documents.title: the great escape bike on show at triumph exhibition
text: the motorcycle used for the famous jump in the steve mcqueen classic the great escape has gone on display for the first time at triumph 's uk factory in hinckley .
the triumph tr6 trophy took about two months to restore and 95 % of the original parts have been retained .
dick shepherd , who restored it , said it is in `` full working order '' .
bikes from jurassic world and mission impossible ii are also on show .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: travel : delays across the east midlands
text: travel : delays across the east midlands
author: BBC News Travel

documents.title: 'record levels ' of 999 calls made to police
text: leicestershire police said yesterday was their busiest day in four years .
in total the force dealt with 1,025 incidents .
during one four-hour period the force received an average of one 999 call every minute .
the `` record levels '' of demand has been put down to it being halloween and because there were several other serious incidents , including a lorry fire on the m1 .
the sheer volume of calls , and the many incidents which required the deployment of lots of resources , caused a real strain on the force yesterday .
as result , we simply could not attend every incident as swiftly as we would have liked , and there remain incidents and issues reported to us yesterday that had to be put on hold until today . ''
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : today 's weather for the east midlands
text: here 's what 's coming our way today .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: join us for today 's live news coverage
text: good morning east midlands - welcome to november .
i 'll be writing your live page today along with gavin bevis .
we 'll have all the latest news , sport , weather and travel from across the region .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us you can send an email or use facebook or twitter .
author: Amy Woodfield
BBC Local Live
